name: biomni-query-dbsnp
title: Biomni: Query Dbsnp
description: Query NCBI's dbSNP database for single nucleotide polymorphisms and short genetic variants with population frequency data.
content:
Overview

Searches dbSNP, NCBI's comprehensive database of common genetic variation containing over 600 million submitted variants. Provides information on SNPs, indels, microsatellites, and other genomic variants with population allele frequencies, validation status, and functional annotations.

Input Parameters

  • prompt (string, optional): Natural language query about SNPs or genetic variants
  • search_term (string, optional): Direct search term or rsID (e.g., "rs12345" or "APOE gene variants")
  • max_results (integer, optional): Maximum number of results to return (default: 3)

Input Format

Create a JSON file with the following structure:

{
  "prompt": "Find SNPs in the APOE gene",
  "search_term": "APOE[gene]",
  "max_results": 10
}

Biological Use Case

Essential for population genetics studies, GWAS analysis, variant annotation pipelines, pharmacogenomics research, and understanding genetic diversity. Researchers use dbSNP to identify common variants, assess allele frequencies across populations, distinguish pathogenic from benign variants, and study the genetic basis of complex traits and diseases.

Output

Returns a JSON file (dbsnp_results.json) containing variant identifiers (rs numbers), genomic coordinates, alleles, population frequencies from different ethnic groups, validation status, functional consequences, gene context, and links to related database entries.

Category

database
